Maven M2E Code Style plugin

  • Organizational POM
  • Coding standards
  • Commons testing
  • Java archetype
  • Other projects

m2e-codestyle:configure

Full name:

net.trajano.mojo:m2e-codestyle-maven-plugin:2.0.0:configure

Description:

Configures Eclipse before any builds.

Attributes:

  • Requires a Maven project to be executed.
  • The goal is thread-safe and supports parallel builds.
  • Binds by default to the lifecycle phase: initialize.

Required Parameters

Name Type Since Description
destDir File - The directory that contains the Eclipse settings.
Default value is: ${basedir}/.settings.

Optional Parameters

Name Type Since Description
codeStyleBaseUrl String -

This is the URL that points to the base URL where the mergable prefs files are located. If this is not provided, then merging of property files is not performed.

The URL must end with a trailing slash as the names referenced by prefsFiles are resolved against it. If the trailing slash is missing, it will append it automatically and log a warning.

If this is not an absolute URL, it assumes that the value passed in is referring to something in the classpath.
javaCleanupProfileXmlUrl String -

This is the URL that points to the Java cleanup profile XML. The contents of this will be merged into "org.eclipse.jdt.ui.prefs"

If this is not an absolute URL, it assumes that the value passed in is referring to something in the classpath.
javaFormatterProfileXmlUrl String -

This is the URL that points to the Java formatter profile XML. The contents of this will be merged into PreferenceFileName.JDT_CORE

If this is not an absolute URL, it assumes that the value passed in is referring to something in the classpath.


User property is: codestyle.java.formatter.xml.
javaScriptCleanupProfileXmlUrl String -

This is the URL that points to the JavaScript cleanup profile XML. The contents of this will be merged into PreferenceFileName.JSDT_UI.

If this is not an absolute URL, it assumes that the value passed in is referring to something in the classpath.
javaScriptFormatterProfileXmlUrl String -

This is the URL that points to the JavaScript formatter profile XML. The contents of this will be merged into PreferenceFileName.JSDT_CORE.

If this is not an absolute URL, it assumes that the value passed in is referring to something in the classpath.
javaScriptTemplatesXmlUrl String -

This is the URL that points to the JavaScript formatter profile XML. The contents of this will be merged into "org.eclipse.wst.jsdt.core.prefs"

If this is not an absolute URL, it assumes that the value passed in is referring to something in the classpath.
javaTemplatesXmlUrl String -

This is the URL that points to the Java formatter profile XML. The contents of this will be merged into "org.eclipse.jdt.core.prefs"

If this is not an absolute URL, it assumes that the value passed in is referring to something in the classpath.
prefsFiles List - A list of prefs files to load from the source. The contents of the prefs files will be merged with the existing prefs files if they already exist. This defaults to DEFAULT_PREFS which are known prefs relating to code styles.

Parameter Details

codeStyleBaseUrl:

This is the URL that points to the base URL where the mergable prefs files are located. If this is not provided, then merging of property files is not performed.

The URL must end with a trailing slash as the names referenced by prefsFiles are resolved against it. If the trailing slash is missing, it will append it automatically and log a warning.

If this is not an absolute URL, it assumes that the value passed in is referring to something in the classpath.

  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No

destDir:

The directory that contains the Eclipse settings.
  • Type: java.io.File
  • Required: Yes
  • Default: ${basedir}/.settings

javaCleanupProfileXmlUrl:

This is the URL that points to the Java cleanup profile XML. The contents of this will be merged into "org.eclipse.jdt.ui.prefs"

If this is not an absolute URL, it assumes that the value passed in is referring to something in the classpath.

  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No

javaFormatterProfileXmlUrl:

This is the URL that points to the Java formatter profile XML. The contents of this will be merged into PreferenceFileName.JDT_CORE

If this is not an absolute URL, it assumes that the value passed in is referring to something in the classpath.

  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • User Property: codestyle.java.formatter.xml

javaScriptCleanupProfileXmlUrl:

This is the URL that points to the JavaScript cleanup profile XML. The contents of this will be merged into PreferenceFileName.JSDT_UI.

If this is not an absolute URL, it assumes that the value passed in is referring to something in the classpath.

  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No

javaScriptFormatterProfileXmlUrl:

This is the URL that points to the JavaScript formatter profile XML. The contents of this will be merged into PreferenceFileName.JSDT_CORE.

If this is not an absolute URL, it assumes that the value passed in is referring to something in the classpath.

  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No

javaScriptTemplatesXmlUrl:

This is the URL that points to the JavaScript formatter profile XML. The contents of this will be merged into "org.eclipse.wst.jsdt.core.prefs"

If this is not an absolute URL, it assumes that the value passed in is referring to something in the classpath.

  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No

javaTemplatesXmlUrl:

This is the URL that points to the Java formatter profile XML. The contents of this will be merged into "org.eclipse.jdt.core.prefs"

If this is not an absolute URL, it assumes that the value passed in is referring to something in the classpath.

  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No

prefsFiles:

A list of prefs files to load from the source. The contents of the prefs files will be merged with the existing prefs files if they already exist. This defaults to DEFAULT_PREFS which are known prefs relating to code styles.
  • Type: java.util.List
  • Required: No
